item.description:
In a crazy experiment that went haywire, scientists accidently opened the portal to four parallel universe! Meanwhile, four different UFOs from the four different multiverse was split due to fraction of space! Scientists now fight anxiously to piece the UFOs back together in order to avoid cosmic chaos.

UFOSå®‡å®™è¿·èˆª (USO Tumble) is an abstract, tile-placing board game. Unlike typical games, it features an unique mechanism: a board that can be turned and rotated, where tiles will fall or not fall depending on their corresponding colors, and re-arranging the module as it goes.

The board is a 5x5 grid, with four different colors on each side representing the four universes. Tiles with colors matching the bottom side will gain anti-gravity, which means they will not fall downwards and can be placed anywhere. The tiles are magnetic, allowing players to shift the tiles freely on the board throughout the game.

Come challenge your ability of spatial cognition and prediction, outsmart your opponents and win by piecing together as much UFOs as you can!

Messina 1347 is a boardgame for 1-4 players, 45-90 min duration.


 selected for ProtoLab Cannes 2018
 winner in Zona Lúdica 2017
 selected for Granollers 2019
 selected for Iludo 2018
 
 


In 1347 the Black Death was first introduced to Europe via Genovese traders, who took the plague by ship into Messina, Sicily. The result: 75 to 200 million people killed by disease in five years. Are you ready to survive?

Each player will control a family of citizens in the town of Messina, who need to prosper among the plague. Your goal is to make more gold and more influence (military, civil and religious) than your rivals, while you make an effort to contain the Plague.

—description from the designer

Meow… meow… Aww, there are so many cute kittens that need to be adopted in Math Cat! But they are only interested to a person who bring their favorite stuff and number (yeah because it's a game of math of course). As a cat lover, you can attract their attention with different kind of lures that you have. Just be cautious that you are not the only one who interested in adopting these cats! So, are you ready to adopt these adorable creatures...with math?

The gameplay is simple. You, as a cat lover, want to adopt a cat by giving them a lure card that has a number on it. When the lure card(s) in play can be calculated equal to the number on the cat card, you deserve to adopt that adorable cat. The game ends when no lure card or no cat card can be acquired. The player who has collected the most cats wins.

There's also a speed mode in which your speed of counting is tested among your peers...but be careful, you must maintain your manner if you don't want those adorable cats run off from you.

item.description:
Think fast before you pass! Dig into the fast-passing card game of Sporks. Choose which food to collect and race to get as many as you can, but stay sharp as you also need the right spork to win. The wild spork gives you the edge, but will you be quick enough to grab it?

—description from the publisher

AceHole is a remix of the most popular card game for drinking on college campuses: Asshole. 
Despite its popularity, the game asshole was never formalized with written instructions or rules.
AceHole fixes all that!
What makes our game so much different and (and better) than all of the games that are being played every day across the country in countless colleges and universities (since the beginning of time)?

 We have compiled all of your favorite rules and many new ones from all across the United States. We came up with over 100 drinking rules.
 No more memorization! All the rules will be laid in front of you on our cards!
 We have included a beautifully designed 54 card custom playing card deck.
 All cards are from the 54-card deck and rule cards are printed on 100% ALCOHOL PROOF PVC! NO MORE PARTY FOULS!




—description from the designer

Cards Against Downtime is a party game for SysAdmins. If you’re not a SysAdmin, you should at least be a human being to play this game. You are at least one of them? Awesome!

There are very few rules for this game. Each round, one player asks a question from a black card, and everyone else answers with their most awkward white card. And of course, it all is based on Cards Against Humanity, but adapted to an exceptional target group – you.

—description from the designer

item.description:
In Tolomeo, players demonstrate their knowledge of astronomy to observe the sky and anticipate the planets' movement. Be careful because the speed of each planet differs in line with the Ptolemaic model, and you should consider the sun and moon as well. If you want a shot at victory, you have to spot astral conjunctions, make the best use of the comet, and take advantage of the planets' influence on each other.

—description from the publisher

item.description: The Snails on the Wall game is a simple roll and move game where players move their piece along the playing board wall according to the roll of a die. The first to reach the top is declared the winner

name.value: The Very Hungry Caterpillar: Twirl and Toss

item.description: A child's game from Briarpatch. Players take turns tossing pieces of plushy fruit onto the leaves and caterpillar (small hook and loop circles) as it twirls on a motorized base. The first to stick all of their fruit wins the game.

Europe is full of things to see and do, and you've decided to get a slice of the action in The Great Tour: European Cities. Transport tourists in your bus between the great cities to see the sights, from the La Scala in Milan to the Arc de Triomphe in Paris, and many others! However, you'll have to contend with your competitors who are less than eager to let you win.

In more detail, plan your journey, draw ticket cards, and drive your bus from one destination to the next. For each complete journey, you receive points that count toward your final score. You are also rewarded for each new destination, the most completed journeys, and more.

Keep your wheels turning because the great tour has just begun!

—description from the back of the box

item.description:
The restaurant got a negative review and the manager is trying to find out who is responsible.

13 Chefs is a stand-alone microgame for 2 players, set in the same settings as Kitchen Rush.

In 13 Chefs your goal is to guess your opponent's secret Character card before they guess yours. On your turn, you either play a card face-up to perform its ability, or play it face-down and guess at your opponent's Character.

The first player to win 3 rounds wins the game!

Note: This is a reimplementation of 13 Ghosts that was given for free to backers of the Kitchen Rush KS Campaign. It is no longer available.

The herd of horses is spread out across the whole paddock. But when they are collected for riding, all the horses come to the gate at top speed.

An exciting game to support quickness and hand-eye coordination.

Every player gets a set of identical cards, which look like Domino stones and show one or two horses in different colors.

The paddock cards form a draw pile. Once a paddock card is flipped, all players try to arrange their cards in the form of the shown paddock card as quickly as possible.

The quickest player wins the paddock card. When the draw pile with the paddock cards runs out, the player with the most paddock cards is the winner of the game.
—user summary (English)

Die Pferdeherde hat sich über die ganze Koppel verteilt. Doch wenn sie zum Reiten abgeholt werden, kommen alle Pferde ganz schnell ans Gatter.

Ein spannendes Ablegespiel, bei dem neben Schnelligkeit auch die Augen-Hand-Koordination gefördert wird.

Jeder Spieler erhält einen identischen Satz an Pferdekarten, die wie Dominosteine aufgebaut sind und 1 oder 2 Pferde in unterschiedlichen Farben aufweisen.

Vom Stapel mit den Koppelkarten wird eine Karte aufgedeckt und alle Spieler versuchen gleichzeitig, die Koppel so schnell wie möglich nachzubauen.

Der jeweils schnellste Spieler bekommt die Koppelkarte als Belohnung. Wer am Ende die meisten Koppelkarten gewonnen hat, gewinnt auch das Spiel.
—user summary (German)

name.value: Tales of the Northlands: The Sagas of Noggin the Nog

item.description:
'In the lands of the North, where the Black Rocks stand guard against the cold sea, in the dark night that is very long the Men of the Northlands sit by their great log fires and they tell a tale... '

So began each of the Sagas of Noggin the Nog, in which the crown of Noggin, Prince of the Nogs is sought by his wicked uncle Nogbad the Bad who devises evil plots to threaten the safety of the kingdom, in order to force Noggin to give up his crown. In this game, players are the noble Lords of the north, looking to assist Noggin however they can in his adventures with resources and wise council.

Players use their influence to take actions on the board which as a back drop is Peter Firmin's classic hand drawn map of the Northlands. The time taken on each action is plotted on a roundel which acts as the game clock, changes the turn order and progresses the seasons. However Nogbad is never far away from the source of the Kingdom's troubles and Noggin must use his cleverness, intuition and resourcefulness to thwart Nogbad and confirm his position as King of the Nogs. The game ends when Noggin secures the crown or if Nogbad manages to get there first.

In Tales of the Northlands: The Sagas of Noggin the Nog, players must work together to successfully complete the adventures revealed by the saga cards. By offering much needed resources and making key decisions that effect the progress of the adventures, players will, if successful add to Noggin's popularity. Should their decision be unwise or they take too long the popular vote might sway toward Nogbad.

The game includes all of the characters from the TV series, Noggin, his Queen Nooka, Knut their son, Thor Nogson the grumpy Captain of the Royal Guard, Graculus the Great Green Bird, Olaf the Lofty, the Court inventor, and Romf, the little man from the Hot Water Valley.

These adventures are all based upon the books and stories developed by Oliver Postgate and Peter Firmin. The game is fully licensed has access to all artwork previously released in books and film and includes over fifty new pieces of new artwork commissioned from Peter Firmin specifically for the game. The game has three levels, solo, a family game with simplified rule set and a gamer's version with deeper strategy options.

item.description:
Dog Might Games is back with its newest title Countdown: Action Edition! With a short play time, tons of player options, built-in moderator, and unique role-playing mechanics, Countdown: Action Edition delivers a totally new hidden role experience.

One reckless Action Hero.
An out of control hostage situation.
Who will you trust?

In Countdown: Action Edition players become characters within a 1980’s action flick. Villains have taken hostages and rigged the whole place to blow, but they didn’t count on the timely arrival of the Action Hero. Thinking fast they’ve hidden themselves among the hostages waiting to be released. There’s not enough time to save everyone. Get the innocent hostages out while leaving the bad guys behind to fall victim to their own plots. Unfortunately for our Hero, many of the hostages also have their own plans to use this situation to their advantage.

The new Countdown Deck system creates exciting tension by randomly triggering the end of the game. Since no one knows which card will be the bomb every decision is critical, and games stay fast and fun.

A moderator is built directly into gamplay through the Action Hero. Making sure that everyone gets in on the fun while still keeping the game organized and flowing.

Action Scene Cards make sure that every player gets an opportunity to take center stage and can redirect the movie scene with unexpected plot twists.    
 Role Playing is a core part of gameplay making each game a hilarious and different experience. Watch your friends drop epic one liners and do their best 80’s movie impressions. The amazing art from Andrew Thompson is designed to help everyone, from new role players to experienced actors, get into character.

Jam packed with nostalgia and humor, Countdown: Action Edition offers many new twists on the beloved hidden role genre.

—description from the publisher

In Buzz Around the players control a swarm of insects and try to get through a field of flowers, surviving the hazards that threaten them! In addition to the basic roll and move system the game adds interesting decision points with clever card play and choosing the optimal route through the ever rotating flowers.

The player who first gets his or hers swarm safely through the field wins the game!

Have you heard the hit song “WES WILL COOK JOE”? Or seen the classic movie “YOUR WRIST PUMP”? How about the children’s book “FOOD FIGHT DUDE”? What? You mean you don’t know them? That’s because they’re OUT OF ORDER! Take away a letter here, add a letter there and in 5 steps the correct answer is revealed! Clues are read one at a time. Be the first to unscramble and identify the OUT OF ORDER title to win!

—description from the publisher

Evil Corp is a darkly humorous and competitive game for 2-6 players with a focus on Take That, lots of careful Hand Management and some Area Control/Influence. If you play with casual gamer friends they'll get it in one round.

So the game Spiel:

A boardgame of revolutionary technology Ceo's. It's time to save the world, no matter the cost...

Thematically: Internet Tech Titans are the new masters of the universe. The power they wield through technology is staggering.

Now you get to step into their shoes in a game of nasty business dealings, broken promises and compromised ethics.

We're live on Kickstarter until the 14th of July: http://bit.ly/getevilcorp

The Cell Games are on and the world's greatest fighters have gathered see if they have what it takes to defeat Cell, the perfect warrior. Teaming up to take him down, Goku, Gohan, Vegeta, Krillin, Trunks and Piccolo must strategize together to stop the supposedly unstoppable machine.

In Dragon Ball Z: Perfect Cell, 2-4 players will each take control of an iconic Dragon Ball Z fighter and roll their dice to generate energy. Using custom icons, players allocate their dice into performing attacks, helping other players or buying upgrades. Players need to work together though, as Cell will continue to generate new threats that can heal him, damage all players or lock players out of potentially game-changing upgrades.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Once all the sassy villagers have been eaten and the treasure hoarded up, it's time for some after dinner relaxation. So the dragons play a fun little game rolling around leftover human skulls. Nothing washes down a nice meal of humans like the taste of victory!

Dragoon: Heads Will Roll is a multiplayer dexterity game in which players roll out a fistful of skulls across the table, then attempt to flick themselves around scoring points based on where the skulls have landed. The first player to score 21 points wins!

—description from the publisher

name.value: Shadows of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game

item.description:
Shadows of Kilforth is the sequel and stand-alone expansion to Gloom of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game. It is a game of high fantasy with a gothic edge, where 1-4 players, working individually or together, assume the roles of heroes on a journey through a dark world of magic and peril. They will visit strange places, meet stranger people and defeat powerful enemies in their mission to discover mysterious artefacts and mystical spells. Each player follows their hero’s tale, an epic saga from modest beginnings through to a climactic battle that will decide the fate of the world...

—description from the publisher

This project was known earlier as 'Touch of Death: A Fantasy Quest Game'.

As of 2019-02-25, the Kickstarter is expected to launch in March of 2019.

link.value: Gloom of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game

item.description:
ATK! The Board Game is a 2 player 3v3 MOBA Style Board Game. Assemble your team of 3 Elemental Heroes. Each Hero has a spinnable base that is used for the attack mechanism. Your team is also equipped with 2 towers and a base. These structures have a health system that is easy to keep track of with a counting system built in.

Your goal is to destroy your opponent's base while protecting your own. Any time you defeat enemy Heroes you earn specialty cards that can assist you to victory. These cards include damage boosters for single attacks, respawn delays to assign to your opponent's hero, and much more.

Battling structures is simple, choose your Hero, flip upside down and spin the spinner. Reference your Hero Cards to add a value or action to your spin's outcome. If it's an attack, subtract that amount to the structure's health. Deplete all health on a tower and it is removed from play giving you a clear path to the base. When attacking an enemy Hero, flip both Heroes over and spin. Higher number wins without elemental influence.

Strategically maneuver your way into your opponent's base area and destroy their base. Upon doing so, claim the title of the ATK! Champion. Reset and Play Again!

—description from the designer

name.value: The Battle of Wakefield: Yorkshire, England 30 December 1460

item.description:
It was at Wakefield that Richard, Duke of York, met his doom. Richard was head of the Yorkist faction, and had begun the rebellion against King Henry VI that is now known as the War of the Roses. It isn't clear why he rode out that day against an army with numerical superiority, but the end result was calamity for the Yorkist contingent. About half the army perished, including Richard and the Earl of Salisbury (father of Warwick the kingmaker). Can you break the Lancastrian army before its reinforcements arrive or will you share Richard's fate?

The Battle of Wakefield is a new, fully self-contatined game in RBM Studio's C3i magazine #31, and is a part of GMT's Men of Iron series, specifically Blood & Roses (2014).

—description from the publisher

Game Scale:
Game Turn: Abstract
Hex: 75 yards / 68.5 meters
Units: Groups of soldiers (approx 250 per unit)

Game Inventory (C3i magazine version):
One 11 x 17" full color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (230 counters of multiple sizes - only 116 1/2" counters are for this game)
One 12-page Battle of Wakefield rules booklet
Three player aid sheets (1 single-side printed)

Players will have to furnish One 10-sided die for game play

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 1-4 hours

item.description:
For whatever reason, all of the freakishly aggressive predators in your care have escaped! The surrounding wildlife is in danger! As one of the only park rangers on duty, it’s your job to protect all of the adorable creatures in your reserve. You are the only thing stopping a predator from an all you can eat baby buffet.
Most games require a high score to win - not this game. In PreyCare, you reduce your score by matching up cards in the same column. The lower your score, the less blood you’ll have on your hands. Be careful though, matching up cards activate special abilities that may not be what you were hoping for!

The game is simple. You have to match cards in the same column. Failure to match up the cards means you have screwed up and your baby creature gets mauled. Most games require you to have the highest score in order to win. Not this game though. Each point above zero is blood on your hands. The player with the lowest score by the end of the game is the “winner”. Reducing your score is simple: whenever you match two cards in the same column, their numbers cancel each other out and their value becomes zero. If you don’t match a column up, well we have bad news for you. You gotta add the numbers together – it’s basically a kill count, you failure. Add up all columns together, and the player with the least amount of carcasses is as close to a winner as they come – considering the fact that you’re dealing with adorably dead animals.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Capio is a fast family boardgame with 40 coloured dice and 84 cards for 2-4 players from age 8-99 years.
40 coloured dice are cast and here we go! The players pick up the dice they need to fulfill the tasks shown on their cards and place them on their cards. The dice put down must correspond with the patterns on the card chosen. Also, each die must go together with the specific function of the card chosen.

The player who is fastest and makes no mistakes is the winner.
Capio presents a number of challenges: perception, reaction times and adaptive tactics are some of the abilities which this boardgame requires.

Confabula Rasa is a cooperative word construction and storytelling game for two to six players featuring a deck of non-linear word fragment cards. You play as ghosts possessing a group of kids in a cabin in the woods, trying to figure out how you died by piecing together your fragmented memories.

Play is started by shuffling the 26 double-sided word fragment cards (Fewer cards can be used for a faster game). Each player is dealt one card (they can flip the card to the other side at any time). One card is placed in the middle of the table. Any player may start play. The first player places the card from their hand onto the tableau so that it forms a word using one or more letters from the card already in the tableau. The player may put the card on top of the card already on the table, or slide the card underneath, as long as the card on the table is not shuffled around. When the first player has formed a word, they draw a word fragment card from the pile and point to another player. The player pointed to must start to tell the story of the death of the ghosts from the ghosts’ point of view, incorporating the word that was just made. For example, if the first player formed the word “angst,” the player they pointed to could say: “The last thing I remember is a feeling of angst as I slumped through the halls.”

Any player may go next by adding their card to the growing tableau to make a new word and pointing to a player to continue the story (as long as a player does not make a word twice in a row). Play continues until all the cards in the deck and players' hands are gone. The last person to make a word points to the player who will bring the story to a satisfactory close in which "Everyone dies!"

The inspiration behind the game is "anyone can be a storyteller!"

—description from the designer

Stool Pigeon is a quick memory based card game. The goal is to lower the value of your hand or get rid of your hand entirely. Players start the game knowing 2 of their 4 cards. Players take turns drawing 1 card and either swapping it with one in their hand,or if it is an action card, playing it and using its ability. 
Action cards let you peek at unknown cards, switch cards with your opponents and much more! Quick hands and sharp minds give you opportunities to get rid of cards from your hand. 
The round is over when you someone decides, by knocking as their turn. Forcing all other players to draw one last time. Lowest hand wins.

"Voter Beware" (SubrogÄtor Cave, in Latin) is a political dice rolling game about Food Truck politics. Bernie Salad, Hilaire, Gervais Juanson, and Donny Sausage all wish to become President of the Food Truck Association, the political position which controls all of the menus on local food trucks. In this game, one to four players will take turns rolling four dice and assigning them to each candidate, who in turn will utilize the die assigned them based on its value.

Possible actions include buying influence, buying votes, enhancing your influence with a funding PAC, or delivering a nasty Dirty Trick to an opponent's campaign, lowering their stature with PACs and potentially hurting their ability to compete. At the end of each turn, a Scandal may erupt which damages a candidate's reputation with the voting blocs that they buy votes from.

This is a unique, one to four-player political game that takes between 20-40 minutes to play, and with simple-to-understand rules but truly difficult decisions each turn, it's perfect for a coffee shop or lunch hour either by yourself or with friends.

—description from the designer

All players start with a private brewery (minor company) plus the pMGs from the starting package (coal mines and steel mills). The new features is the beer market for which the brewery produce and deliver. The basic demand of the beer market will be increased during the course of the game due to the development of the MONTAN companies. Each time they buy a capex card and acquire development markers the demand of the beer market will increase. This reflects the additional workforce (and consequently an increas of Dortmund's inhabitants) the MONTAN companies will need in order to handel additional equipment. The equipment for the breweries is on the backside of the capex cards. In order to acquire the latest most competive equipment a private brewery may be forced to be converted into a brewery corporation in order to generate additional treasury. During the brown phase the railway companies will transport beer to the off-board destinations which will increase the breweries' income proportionally.

The Awful Orphanage is a mildly devious tabletop game for 2 to 6 players.

Take control of a unique Orphan and navigate the ever changing rooms and corridors of Ms. Prendergast's Home for Wayward Children uncovering loot, avoiding orderlies and escaping from the nefarious Gaunt & Sinister Man!

Players take it in turns searching rooms in the hope of finding one of the hidden magical items with which you will free yourself from the Orphanage and end the reign of terror.

Use items including Pots & Pans, Bricks and Bottles to fight the Orderlies then ruin your friends turn with tricks including Bags of Marbles and Itching Powder all whilst dodging the Orphanage employees! Whatever you do, always look over your shoulder when trying to escape The Awful Orphanage!

—description from the publisher

There can only be one winner.

Cogs and Commissars is a "take that" drafting card game about the glorious robot revolution. Become your robot party's Propaganda Minister and win the citizens over to your revolutionary cause! Use every trick in the dystopian book to brainwash the masses and stop your opponents in their treads!

At its core, Cogs and Commissars is a casual drafting game about growing/stealing a following of robots. Your seven-card hand determines which actions are available to you that round. Hand management is key; look for winning combinations. During your turn, you might rouse the proletariat, reprogram the bourgeoisie, or even recruit valuable commissars. Each of these citizens are worth points; when you have 15 points of citizens, you may attempt a revolution! The first player to successfully pull off playing their revolution card wins.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Stau-Mau Mau is a family game from the 'Haba Reisspeile' collection.

This game is similar to Uno. You get to a number of different car tokens in different colors. On the central gameboard you need to put down your tokens and get rid of all of them. You can put a vehicle after a vehicle of the same color or the same shape. As you lay out your pieces you create a big traffic jam across the board. Some cars have no special function others make the next player to skip a turn, give the player an extra turn or makes the next player take more tokens.

The goal of the game is to get rid of all your tokens, when you have one token left, you need to shout something or you need to take a new token from the reserve.

The game is played totally on magnetic surfaces which is nice. The players get their magnetic tokens on parking lot cards in their hands to keep them secret. The board is laid out in the tin lid thus making it magnetic itself. This makes it perfect to play everywhere.

There are 32 car tokens, 3 parking lots and one main board in the box.

Make your fate! Inspired by character-driven fantasy storytelling, Call to Adventure challenges 2-4 players to create the hero with the greatest destiny by acquiring traits, facing challenges, and overcoming adversaries.

Call to Adventure features a unique "rune rolling" system for resolving challenges, a point-based system that encourages storytelling, and over 150 unique cards. Players begin each game with an origin card that provides their backstory as well as two "starter" abilities. Each round they may either acquire trait cards from the board or face a challenge. Challenges each have two possible paths a player can choose from. For example, players who encounter the Thieves' Guild may choose to train as a spy, or train as a killer. Each challenge has a difficulty that must be overcome by rolling successes on carved runes. The more a player has of the abilities required to overcome the challenge, the more runes they will be able to cast.

Failed challenges lead players to acquire experience points that may be spent to "push" through tougher challenges. But beware, while some negative experiences will help your hero grow, too many tragedies set them on a dark path.

As players' heroes grow in ability and experience, they move on to harder challenges, eventually facing deadly adversaries and acquiring more and more destiny points. The player whose hero has the highest destiny score wins the game.

link.value: Call to Adventure: Name of the Wind

name.value: ダイスキングチェス (Dice King Chess)

item.description:
A new set for the classic trick-taking game Wizard, now playable by only two players. This deck includes 36 cards and some new rules.

3 cards are set aside at the beginning, and one of them is turned up to establish the current trump. The remaining cards are divided in 3 groups of 11 cards; each player takes one, and the remaining one forms the dummy deck. Three cards are turned face up from the dummy deck.

Players bid on how many tricks they think they will take in the coming hand. Next the first player plays a card from their hand, then a card from the dummy's hand, and then the second player plays a card. The trick goes to the first player who played a Wizard, or by the player who played the highest trump, or to the player who played the highest lead card. Jesters always lose. The dummy player may win a trick, and in fact its role is to help the first player winn or lose a trick as needed. The player who won the round becomes the first player and starts the next round.

When players run out of cards, they check their bids and score. You score for making your bid exactly, and lose points if you did not make your bid.
This version also has a special card that cancels the trick in which it is played - no one scores that trick.

First player to score 100 points is the winner.

Cube War is a 2 player area control game set in the Sengoku period in Japan. Players will draft battle cards at the start of the game to use in battles through out the game. Each player will fight over the areas on the map with cubes and the game is won when a player have the most victory points at the end of the game.

Pulgosos, the brave mutts of Canidus City, meets around the central garden to find their most precious buried treasures. But won’t be an easy task. Although the smell of the mutt is almost infallible, sometimes they get carried away by emotion and end up by unearthing whatever. Guide them to the most recondite corners of the garden, so they can find the most bones as possible without losing sight of your rivals. On your turn, you have to solve one of the 2 following actions:

1.Explore: Inspect an area by digging one zone of the garden too check what is under it. Optionally, if you like what you find out... or not, you can place a pulgoso on that zone of the garden.

2.Collect: Take a pulgosos' find from garden.

The game ends when a player get 5th tiles. Then, other players will have one last turn to make one last collect (if possible). 
Player with the most bones is the winner.


Los valientes pulgosos de Cánidus City se reúnen alrededor del gran jardín central para encontrar sus mas preciados tesoros enterrados. Pero cuidado! Porque aunque el olfato de los pulgosos es casi infalible, a veces se dejan llevar por la emoción y acaban desenterrando cualquier cosa. Guíalos a los rincones más recónditos del jardín para que encuentren la mayor cantidad de huesos sin perder de vista a tus rivales. En tu turno debes resolver una de las siguientes 2 acciones:

1. Explorar: Inspecciona y excava un área del jardín y mira que hay debajo. Opcionalmente, si te gusta lo que ves... o no, puedes colocar un pulgoso en esa zona del jardín.

2. Recolectar: Coge el hallazgo de un pulgoso del jardín.

La partida acaba cuando un jugador consigue su 5ta loseta. Entonces el resto de jugadores tendrá un ultimo turno para recolectar (si es posible). 
El jugador con la mayor cantidad de huesos es el ganador.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
A simplified P-n-P board game with small play tiles with a design of play for younger players to help with matching four types of birds in a garden, counting colours (flower beds), counting scores along a score track, taking turns and taking tiles from a cup or bag. The game can also be played by older players as well, as there are Advanced Optional Rules included – the game can actually get quite tactical for older players. The game is designed for 2 players but can be played with 4 in pairs.

The correct placing of the bird types and the 'wild tile' fish pond tiles scores points which are recorded on the included score track and the winner has the highest score at the end of the game. There is also some final end-game scoring of only the coloured background tiles of the birds that have been placed within each players own columns of garden squares. Bonus points can also be scored by correctly placing the 'wild tile' fish ponds in a player's garden column.

This P-n-P home-made test version includes the game-board (that represents a garden of squares and a score track), a counter-mix and a set of game rules for use by families with younger (and older) gamers at BGG to try out. It should only take about 15-30 mins to play a game.

Rome is going to hell. Redneck barbarians are raiding the borders, the economy is in freefall, and the sewer workers are on strike...again. To top it all, mercenaries and slaves have delusions of grandeur (they want to be paid, for Jupiter's sake!), while those petty pencil pushers at the Senate indulge in never-ending rhetoric displays. As a wealthy patrician, you're pretty sure it is expected that you lend your help to Rome in this dire time of need, but then again will your "friends" do the same? The Ides of March are around the corner...'

Vae Victis is a semi-competitive game of decline and treachery for 2 to 6 Roman patricians. The phrase "Vae Victis" — Latin for "woe to the vanquished" or "woe to the conquered" — suggests that those defeated in battle are entirely at the mercy of their conquerors and should neither expect nor request leniency. Keep that spirit in mind when playing this game. Players take turns alternatively, and on their turn, they must go through three phases:


 Doom phase: The player rolls the three doom dice, eliminates one of them, then applies the result of the remaining two dice.
 Support phase: The player can take up to two actions in any combination in the action spots LIMITES, AERARIUM, or DOMUS PALATINA, possibly pushing their luck!
 Influence phase: The player can take up to two actions in any combination in the action spots THERMAE, FORUM, or CURIA.


After this, play passes to the next player. Play continues until a winning condition is met, with the conditions being as follows:


 All players lose if one of the wars is lost or one of the tracks reaches the final space. No player can decide to lose a war or make a track reach its final space if they can avoid it — unless they are the traitor (see below).
 A player loses at the end of any turn if they've run out of coins.
 A player wins at the end of their turn if they simultaneously fulfill the requirement of their goal card "SENATE" and their goal card "WAR".
 A player wins at the end of any turn if all other players have lost.


Note that any player can be a traitor to Rome, and they win if a condition is met that results in all players losing the game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: In The Brainiac Game, players spin the SMART Spinner, then compete to answer questions in five subject areas: Science, Math, Arts, Reading, and The World. Each Question Card has six different questions tailored to grades 1 to 6, so that players answer questions corresponding to their grade levels. The first player to fill his or her brain with SMART Tokens wins!

2WW is a card game about World War II, the result of a careful historical research that we hope can be appreciated by fans of this subject. It uses an easy and completely-innovative gaming system. In never-repetitive game sessions, you can be one of the main players of the conflict, use the most horrible but celebrated events in your favour, and recreate legendary armies and units. It will be decisive the moment in which you decide to go to war, but above all the strategy that you will pursue to achieve the ultimate victory (economic or military).

—description from the designer (translated)

2WW è un gioco di carte sulla seconda guerra mondiale frutto di una attenta ricerca storica che ci auguriamo possa essere apprezzata dagli appassionati dell’argomento. Esso utilizza un sistema di gioco immediato e del tutto innovativo. In partite mai ripetitive, potrete impersonare i maggiori protagonisti del conflitto, utilizzare gli eventi più nefasti e celebri a vostro favore e ricreare eserciti ed unità a volte leggendari. Sarà determinante il momento nel quale deciderete di entrare in guerra ma soprattutto la strategia che perseguirete per arrivare alla vittoria finale (economica o militare).

—description from the publisher (Italian)

Tour Guide is a solitaire tile laying game. 
As a tour guide you must map out the city, making sure to create all the locations of your tour's itinerary.

There are 4 different scenarios and, depending on the type of tour, you'll need to visit museums and galleries, parks and piazzas, as well as local restaurants.
The more sights your party experiences, the more points you'll score.
And if there's a historic landmark, world famous masterpiece or culinary speciality to take in along the way, then all the better.

If you manage to create all the itinerary locations, then you ‘walk’ your tour route through the city for bonus points.

The game is just 2 pages of tiles/cards and 1 page of rules. You'll also need some small cubes or similar tokens for tracking.

Tour Guide was joint winner of the 2017 Mint Tin Design Contest

Aim of the game: Collect the most number of the IsBut's and Cut Spaghetti recipes.

Flow of the game: Players either use function cards, play recipe cards, or pass and draw cards.

End of the game: When the deck runs out, the player with most recipe cards wins.

Very simple children's game. Fill rubbery eggs with water, one less than the number of players. On their turn players pick up one egg, "break" it open on their forehead, and if they get wet they're out of the game.

Children's game. Spin a spinner to see how many pumpings of air you can use. After a certain amount of them, the air pressure will make the dog poop a foamy ball. The player whose turn it is will score a point. Most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Speed game. On a player's turn they flip a card. If the card contains the correct name of the color as text on the card, players have to slap on the card. The quickest will win all the flipped cards. After all cards are played, the player with most cards won is the winner.

Children's game. Load the rocket with mini stars and start the timer. On players' turns they roll the die and place buckets around the rocket. After the timer runs out, rocket will launch and spread the stars. Players will get the stars that end up in their buckets. First to fill their board with stars is the winner.

When cats arrived in New Zealand in 1640, the Maori Spirits found this animal exceptional.
The secret of his nine lives stoked envy. Cats need to become mighty warriors to preserve it.
Attacking, defending and strengthening your ranks become the only way to win the game.

At your turn you can :

 play a card on a new place (four places max.)
 reinforce a place by playing the same card or a combination to make a total of nine and create a mauw
 attack an other player with a warrior or a spirit




At the end of each turn, players must have four cards or take cards to have four.
The game finishes when a player have three mauw in three columns/places.

—user summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Evolve: Lights of the Deep is a fast-playing card game for 2-4 players, set in the abyssal depths of the ocean. Within the all-consuming darkness of the sea, each player begins life as a single-celled organism and must go through evolutionary progressions to become the most complex life form. Evolve is a competitive game that involves aspects of hand management, tactical decision making and a take-that style of sabotage.

In the game, players need to establish evolutionary links to their current life form, before being able to progress to the subsequent level of organism. Many organisms and evolutionary links have additional bonuses or dual uses, so players are often required to make decisions about when to play cards, or when to keep them in hand. Additionally, ‘adaptation’ cards can also be used to increase the development of your organism, or to hinder players.

During each turn, players perform 6 moves, where they can choose to pick-up, discard or play cards (each action costs 1 move). Evolve gameplay is intuitive yet simple (this is a family-friendly game), while also allowing for various strategies and play styles.

—description from the designer

Every player takes one box with square plates and one roll with rings of the same color. The 1st player places a square plate vertically into any slit of the board. Then the 2nd player places one into any slit he likes and so on. If there is a square with 3 walls the player whose turn it is to play, must shut it by placing the 4th wall. If the square which he has shut, has no number, the next player continues to play. Otherwise the same player has another turn. In shutting one square the respective player puts one of his rings into it. The squares without number count 1, those with a number count as many points as are indicated by the number.

When all squares are shut, the points are counted and the player who has the most, is the winner.

Cube Words is a print&play word game for 2 players. Earn points by forming words using adjacent letters. First player to earn exactly 30 points is the winner.

In his turn, each player can form a 3+ letters word using orthogonally adjacent letters and earn points according to the number of letters. Longer words are considerably more valuable than short words.

After forming a word, each player can use a cube to block a chosen letter. This letter can not be used by the other player.

Each player can only pass through the 20 points mark if he has formad at least one 6+ letters word.

To make things a little more difficult, the winner is the player who reachs exactly 30 points. If you earn more than 30 points, you begin to reduce your scoring!

The game was designed for the 2017 9-Card Nanogame P&P Design Contest.

THE COMPONENTS

All you need to play Cube Words is:

- The cards fronts and backs (one A4 sheet for each)
- 8 cubes, in 2 different colors (4 for each player)

link.value: 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest

item.description:
Meet the environmentally friendly game of the year, FOREST! The first game from Korea to launch at The New York Toy Fair.

How many trees can I grow?
Protect your forest by being the best Forest Ranger. Watch out for crafty lumberjacks, and keep the animals safe from dangerous hunters.

Players take two fruit cards each, which reveal the kind of tree they are protecting. Fruit cards stay hidden. Then, players take turns to plant trees around the Mountain Board, adding lumberjacks, hunters, calamities, animals, and forest ranger cards. When the drawing pile runs out, players complete one last round. Then all players reveal fruit cards, tally up animal and tree points earned, and move pieces up the mountain on the score track. The furthest up the mountain is the winner.

Passaportas, The Board Game takes players back to the 1950's, a time in which air travel was still stood for exceptional adventures. As a travel agent, players will try to bring their own groups of passengers (1, 2, 3 and 4 travellers) from to their respective departure cities to their destinations.

The game board shows the world map with all departure/arrival cities, the different connections between them with their fuel cost, the chartered airplane with ten available seats, a fuel indicator and a customs area. Each player is randomly dealt a departure and destination card for each of their four traveller groups and also receives a number of customs cards. The plane is placed on a randomly chosen starting location. If this happens to be the departure location for any of the players' passengers, these may immediately board the plane and all is clear for take-off.

A players' turn consists of the following actions:

 First, two six-sided dice are rolled and the result is added to the fuel indicator. After that, the player may move the plane using one or more connections, as far as the fuel reserve will allow. 
 If the plane lands at the destination airport for any of the passengers that are on the plane, these are moved to the customs area. When enough seats are available in the plane, new passengers may board the plane at the current location.
 Players may now play matching customs cards for the current location, thereby sending passengers from the customs area and/or the plane back home. Any passengers that are still in the customs area after this phase have successfully completed the trip and count towards victory.
 If previously unavailable seats have opened up during the customs phase, the remaining passengers departing from the current airport may board the plane now.




Play then passes clockwise and continuous until all passengers from a player have made for to their destinations.

name.value: Critical Fumblers In the Dungeon of Intellectual Doom...and the insanity that awaits them!

item.description:
The dastardly mindflayer, Balzak Rimwrecker, Dreamscarrer from the Nigh Beyond (not Canada), has built a dungeon that only the most adept heroes can conquer.
These are not those guys.

Critical Fumblers is a solitaire, map-making, dungeon crawler that satirizes this genre.It won 3rd place in the 2017 Solo PnP Contest under the "dungeon crawler" category, and 10th place in Best Overall Game.

Since this dead horse has not been beaten enough, I took the lamest and most outrageous monsters from my years of playing D&D (not the gelatinous cube, because that's the most awesome monster!) and combined them with some of our group's more entertaining fumble events to bring you a game about a party of idiots fighting the stupidest monsters ever, all explained in this huge run-on sentence.

In this game, you draw your map, move from room to room, encounter a lame monster, and fight using a dice-placement mechanic. Corner rooms have a slightly different mechanic, and the end game is a sort-of Choose-you-own-adventure storyline. You win by visiting all Corner Rooms and then returning to the center of the map. You lose but running out of light or a party wipe. All of this combined will give you about an hour of a comedy of errors...err, entertainment. Enjoy!

Red Aurora is a single-player game offering the player to relive the dramatic historical events of October 1917 in Petrograd as a member of the Military Revolutionary Committee attempting to overthrow the Russian Provisional Government. The game is played on two maps of Petrograd showing historically precise locations of stationed regiments, officer schools, bridges, important buildings and the Winter Palace itself. The player will take control of soldiers, Baltic Fleet sailors and Red Guards attempting to overcome the government forces consisting of Junkers, cossacks and Shock infantry.

Over the course of the game, the player prepares the coup organizing Red Guards, agitates garrisoned regiments, gathers revolutionary forces to prevent the government from bringing more troops into Petrograd and arresting the player. The revolutionary patrols seize crucial points in Petrograd, like train stations, communication centres and power plants, facing opposition from the government that tries to uphold the control of the city. The conflict escalates with the revolutionary forces encircling the Winter Palace and finally assaulting and seizing it during the dark October night. 
The game includes 58 historical events, played in variable chronology, and with 60 minutes of playtime offers excellent replayability. Will the Provisional Government be able to retain the control of Petrograd or will the shot from Aurora usher in a new era in the history of Russia?

Each player picks a Room and chooses a Ball color. The player places 4 Balls of the chosen color in her or her room. Players should make sure the pivoting Doors on the Base of the House are in the open position.
 Agree on an official starter. The starter shouts “Boing!” and everyone starts bouncing his/her Balls into the House of Boing, trying to empty his/her Rooms at the same time.
 Players must always pick up and throw Balls with ONLY ONE HAND. Players can bounce Balls into the unit either through the Window in the side facing them, or bounce Balls up and into the Skylight hole at the top of the House of Boing. You cannot bounce Balls through the Windows facing other players.
 If a Ball drops on the floor, the player who threw the Ball must immediately go and pick it up and get back to the game as quickly as possible.
 Hint: watch other player’s Rooms. If you see someone close to emptying his or her room, then try to bounce more Balls in the direction of his or her Room to stop them from winning.


Winning the Game:
The first player to empty his or her Room of Balls and close the pivoting Door is the winner.

name.value: Trivial Pursuit: National Parks Travel Edition

item.description:
Test your knowledge of America's National Parks with TRIVIAL PURSUIT®: National Parks Travel Edition. Trivia questions from 100 years of National Park history will challenge National Parks travelers, U.S. History buffs, students and families.

Roll the custom die to pick from six categories: Natural Wonders, Battlefields and Historic Sites, Cultural Heritage, Science and Nature, Wildlife and Wildcard. First player to collect 6 cards wins!

Hook the handy travel case to your backpack and play anywhere, around the campfire or even on the hiking trail!

The giraffes are hungry! - Can you help them reach the leaves in the tree?

It takes a steady hand and a clever mind to stack the blocks, reach the reward, and earn the most points.

On each turn, you must roll the die to determine which block you have to use. Keep on stacking turn after turn to stack your giraffe's neck as high as you can.

The higher the leaves are in the tree, the more points they're worth. - Stack as high as possible to win the biggest reward!

But beware. If your giraffe tumbles, you'll have to start all over, and the other giraffes might start chanting -

"Icarus lost his nee-eck! Icarus lost his nee-eck!"

Once all the leaves have been grabbed, everyone flips them over at the same time to count up their points. The player with the most points wins the game!

—description from the publisher

name.value: Eagle Attack!: Market Garden to Arnhem, Sep44

item.description:
This is a very simple (but not simplistic) and fast point-to-point ... the boggy Netherlands terrain made roads even more important, especially for armor/panzer ... regiment/brigade game about Market Garden. 8 one-day turns.

Rules are all of 3 pages. Excellent intro to military/naval history boardgames for family and friends (over the holidays, etc.) Already really popular at the club here in Oslo.

If Fog of War is used, German (hidden until engaged) strength can be Strong/historical, Weak, and Very Weak - Monty's Fantasy - with the games length ... the requirement to open a road/route up to Arnhem ... shortened accordingly. The probability of each of those German strengths can be indicated by Dutch Resistance warning of panzers coming into the area ... or not.

—description from the designer
